name: Predictable Password Reset Token
lay_explain: The reset link uses a guessable code, so attackers can take over accounts.
why_it_matters: Compromises any user with an outstanding reset.

name: Credential Stuffing
lay_explain: Attackers try leaked email/password pairs from other sites to log in.
why_it_matters: Many users reuse passwords; easy large-scale compromise.

name: No Rate Limiting on Reset
lay_explain: Reset flows allow unlimited attempts so tokens and emails can be brute forced.
why_it_matters: Enables guessing and automation at scale.

name: Negative Pricing / Quantity Logic Abuse
lay_explain: Tricks the cart math to produce negative totals or free items.
why_it_matters: Leads to fraud and revenue loss.

name: Firmware Update Interception
lay_explain: Intercepts the device update to install a malicious firmware.
why_it_matters: Gives persistent control of the device.

name: Default Credentials
lay_explain: Device ships with a default password that users may not change.
